Item ID1615

Dragonstone gems are used in Crafting, they are cut from uncut dragonstone with a chisel, requiring 55 Crafting, and yielding 137.5 Crafting experience. Dragonstones are used to make dragonstone jewellery by using it on a furnace with a gold bar and a mould.

Monsters with access to the rare drop table have a chance to drop cut dragonstones.

Dragonstones from the Mage Training Arena minigame are different, providing pizazz points when enchantment spells are used on them and they cannot be taken outside the enchanting chamber.

Training[edit | edit source]

Crafting[edit | edit source]

Crafting dragonstones into jewellery at a furnace requires a gold bar and the appropriate mould.

Level Inputs Material Cost[1] Output Sell Price Profit/loss XP/Craft XP/Hour Coins/XP
55 Uncut dragonstone 14,726 Dragonstone 11,712 −3,014 137.5 398,750 −35.46
55 Dragonstone Gold bar 11,797 Dragonstone ring 11,982 185 100 125,000 1.85
72 Dragonstone Gold bar 11,797 Dragon necklace 11,488 −309 105 131,250 −2.94
74 Dragonstone Gold bar 11,797 Dragonstone bracelet 11,875 78 110 137,500 0.71
80 Dragonstone Gold bar 11,797 Dragonstone amulet (u) 11,749 −48 150 187,500 −0.32
1 Dragonstone amulet (u) Ball of wool 11,789 Dragonstone amulet 12,123 334 4 8,000 83.5
  1. ^ Cost calculated with inputs purchased from the Grand Exchange.

Magic[edit | edit source]

Dragonstone jewellery is enchanted using Lvl-5 Enchant, requiring 68 Magic, 1 Cosmic rune, 15 Earth runes, 15 Water runes along with the piece of dragonstone jewellery. Charged dragonstone jewellery is some of the few usable teleportation methods beyond level 20 up to level 30 Wilderness along with the pharaoh's sceptre, grand seed pod, royal seed pod, slayer ring, and ring of life.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
27 March 2014
(update)

You can now recharge dragonstone jewellery at the Fountain of Rune.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • When attempting to cut a dragonstone, the option to stop cutting the dragonstone into tips is "No! Don't cut my lovely dragonstone!".
